channel.title: Comments on: WoW Players Review EQII

item.title: By: Zygwen
item.dc:creator: Zygwen
item.description: EQ2 isn't in the same league as WoW, it is way ahead of it in many ways except for accounts registered. Although, I don't think that is a bad thing. It keeps the rifraf away.
item.content:encoded: EQ2 isn’t in the same league as WoW, it is way ahead of it in many ways except for accounts registered. Although, I don’t think that is a bad thing. It keeps the rifraf away.

item.title: By: The Junkie
item.dc:creator: The Junkie
item.description: Please, WoW players, Keep playing WoW. Do not play EQ2. We got a good thing going and we dont want all the 12 year olds comming over.
item.content:encoded: Please, WoW players, Keep playing WoW. Do not play EQ2. We got a good thing going and we dont want all the 12 year olds comming over.

item.title: By: Dominik Gabler
item.dc:creator: Dominik Gabler
item.description: EQII had to get a strong and fast fix because until august it simply was not in the same league as wow. To be honest in my mind it still isn't. The game just doesnt feel right (and yes i had a subscription i still do today actually). It started out broken, and while SoE was willing to make changes, some of the common problems (like the way the game runs on mid-end PCs) are still around.
item.content:encoded:
EQII had to get a strong and fast fix because until august it simply was not in the same league as wow.
To be honest in my mind it still isn’t. The game just doesnt feel right (and yes i had a subscription i still do today actually). It started out broken, and while SoE was willing to make changes, some of the common problems (like the way the game runs on mid-end PCs) are still around.

item.title: By: Aughard
item.dc:creator: Aughard
item.description: EQII has come on leaps and bounds since I started as early back as July 05. Constant updates, tweaks etc. but nothing that's put the game back, only moved it forward. It also seems to be a more mature community, and if not mature, certainly friendly.
item.content:encoded: EQII has come on leaps and bounds since I started as early back as July 05. Constant updates, tweaks etc. but nothing that’s put the game back, only moved it forward. It also seems to be a more mature community, and if not mature, certainly friendly.

item.title: By: Foton
item.dc:creator: Foton
item.description: Someone should let me know when EQII considers itself fixed and ready to party. I'd probably give it another go, but there's only so many times I give out "second" chances.
item.content:encoded: Someone should let me know when EQII considers itself fixed and ready to party. I’d probably give it another go, but there’s only so many times I give out “second” chances.

item.title: By: Chris
item.dc:creator: Chris
item.description:
They fixed rogue sneak. You move fast--heck, everyone moves at perma-sprint speed now.
EQ2 isn't the same game that launched in November 2004, while WoW (arguably) hasn't changed significantly. SOE has shown they're willing to rip out and monkey with mechanics, and in the case of EQ2, they made it a much more appealing game.
item.content:encoded:
They fixed rogue sneak. You move fast–heck, everyone moves at perma-sprint speed now.

EQ2 isn’t the same game that launched in November 2004, while WoW (arguably) hasn’t changed significantly. SOE has shown they’re willing to rip out and monkey with mechanics, and in the case of EQ2, they made it a much more appealing game.
